intro: Prosthesia javanica, commonly known as the Javanese prosthesia, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red berries that are toxic to humans. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
